info.title: Whiteflag API
info.description:
This Whiteflag Application Programming Interface (API) is a [Node.js](https://nodejs.org/en/about/) software implementation of the API layer that provides an interface with the Whiteflag messaging network on one or more underlying blockchains. It acts as a message transceiver between one or more blockchains and one or more end-user applications.

This API is a so called Minumum Viable Product (MVP), which means that it only supports the core features of the Whiteflag protocol for development and testing purposes. As such, it serves as the reference implementation of the Whiteflag protocol, but it is not designed and tested for secure usage and performance in a production environment.

This definition documents the API in [OpenAPI format](https://swagger.io/specification/).

Two methods are available for interaction with the API: 1. a [REST API](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_state_transfer) for originators to provide Whiteflag message to be sent on the blockchain, and 2. a [socket.io](https://socket.io/) [web socket](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WebSocket) variant available on `/socket` for clients to listen for incoming Whiteflag messages from a blockchain. A running API has a webpage with embedded socket listener available on [/listen](/listen) and the documented source code at [/docs](/docs).

All response bodies are structured as `{meta, data, errors}`, based on the [JSON API Specification](https://jsonapi.org/format/), which has been used as a guideline (and as a guideline only).

tags.name: Messages
tags.description: Endpoints for operations on Whiteflag messages, such as retrieval, sending, encoding, decoding and validation.

tags.name: Blockchains
tags.description: Endpoints for operations related to a specific blockchain and blockchain accounts, such as blockchain information settings, account information and authentication signatures.

tags.name: Accounts
tags.description: Endpoints for operations related to a specific blockchain accounts, such as creating, updating and deleting accounts.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: Endpoints for operations on Whiteflag authentication, such as signature and token creation and validation.

tags.name: Encryption
tags.description: Endpoints for operations on Whiteflag encryption, such as managing cryptographic keys.

tags.name: Originators
tags.description: Endpoints for operations on Whiteflag originators, such as authentication and management of shared secrets.

tags.name: State
tags.description: Endpoints for operations on the Whiteflag state of a running API instance.

get.description: Returns the human readible Whiteflag protocol specification in HTML format.
Returns the Whiteflag message JSON schema.
Returns the Whiteflag message metaheader JSON schema.
Returns Whiteflag authentication signature JSON schema.
Returns the Whiteflag API state JSON schema.
Returns the requested icon corresponding with a message type.

Returns an array with all incoming and outgoing messages from the primary datastore. The operation accepts MetaHeader fields as optional query parameters. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.

post.description: Transmits a Whiteflag message on a blockchain and returns the result. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.

Accepts a Whiteflag message as if received from a blockchain. This may be done for simulation of incoming messages or if a direct connection with a blockchain node is not possible. Typically only used for testing. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.

Encodes a Whiteflag message and returns the result. Typically used for validation and testing, because this is automatically done for outgoing messages. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.

Decodes a Whiteflag message and returns the result. Typically used for validation and testing, because this is automatically done for incoming messages. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.

Validates the format and reference of a Whiteflag message and returns the result. Typically used for validation and testing, because this is automatically done for incoming and outgoing messages. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.

get.description: Returns an array of all Whiteflag messages referencing the message with the given transaction hash. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.
Returns an array with the Whiteflag messages in a sequence starting with the message with the given transaction hash. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.
Returns an array with all blockchains, regardless of their current status. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.
Returns the configuration and status of the specified blockchain. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.
Returns the accounts of the specified blockchain. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.

post.description: Creates a new account for the specified blockchain. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.

get.description: Returns the details of the specified blockchain account. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.

patch.description: Updates or adds custom properties of the specified blockchain account. Please BE CAREFUL as all attributes can be changed, which may result in an unusable account. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.

delete.description: Deletes the specified blockchain account. Please BE CAREFUL as all blockchain data will be unrecoverably deleted. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.

post.description: Signs a Whiteflag authentication payload for the blockchain address specified in the payload and returns the resulting signature to be used with authentication method 1. This signature should be made available on an internet resource to which an `A1` authentication message refers. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.
Transfers value to another blockchain account. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.

Decodes a Whiteflag authentication signature used for authentication method 1. Typically used for validation and testing, because this is automatically done for incoming messages. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.

Verifies a Whiteflag authentication signature used for authentication method 1. Typically used for validation and testing, because this is automatically done for incoming messages. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.

get.description: Returns the details of all known Whiteflag originators.
Returns the details of the specified Whiteflag originator.

patch.description: Updates the details of the specified Whiteflag originator. Only the provided properties will be updated. Please BE CAREFUL as this may result in loss of critical data such as cryptographic keys. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.

delete.description: Deletes the specified Whiteflag originator. Please BE CAREFUL as this may result in loss of critical data such as cryptographic keys. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.

get.description: Checks for existence of a pre-shared secret encryption key for the specified Whiteflag originator to be used with the specified blockchain account. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.

put.description: Stores or updates a pre-shared secret encryption key for the specified Whiteflag originator to be used with the specified blockchain account. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.

delete.description: Deletes a pre-shared secret encryption key for the specified Whiteflag originator to be used with the specified blockchain account. Please BE CAREFUL as the encryption key will be unrecoverably deleted. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.

post.description: Stores a unique pre-shared secret authentication token together with the provided Whiteflag originator data, both used for authentication method 2. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.

get.description: Checks for the existence of a pre-shared secret authentication token and originator data with the specified token id. This data is used for authentication method 2. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.

delete.description: Deletes the pre-shared secret authentication token and originator data with the specified token id. This data is used for authentication method 2. Please BE CAREFUL as the authentication token will be unrecoverably deleted. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.

post.description: Creates the non-secret Whiteflag authentication token for authentication method 2. This token is to be used as verification data in an `A2` authentication message by the specified blockchain account. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.

get.description:
Returns the requested queue in the Whiteflag state. The queues used by the API are:
 * `initVectors`: stores the initialiation vectors received with `K` messages until the corresponding encrypted message is received
 * `blockDepths`: tracks the block depth of incoming and outgoing messages until their configured confirmation depth is reached. This operation may be disabled in the configuration.

HTTP Authentication.description: The API may be configured to use basic HTTP authentication, as specified in [RFC 7617](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7617). It uses the standard `Authorization` field in the HTTP header as follows: `Authorization: Basic <credentials>`, where the credentials are the base64 encoded username and password joined by a single colon: `<username>:<password>`

blockchainAccount.description: The address identifying a blockchain account
blockchainAccount.name: account

authenticationTokenId.description: The identifer of an originator authentication token
authenticationTokenId.name: authTokenId

transactionHash.description: The hash of a blockchain transaction
transactionHash.name: transactionHash

transactionHashQuery.description: The hash of a blockchain transaction
transactionHashQuery.name: transactionHash

originatorAddressQuery.description: The blockchain address of an originator
originatorAddressQuery.name: originatorAddress

originatorPubKeyQuery.description: The public key of an originator
originatorPubKeyQuery.name: originatorPubKey

recipientAddressQuery.description: The blockchain address of the recipient (only known for decrypted messages)
recipientAddressQuery.name: recipientAddress

transceiveDirectionQuery.description: The transceive direction indicating if a message has been sent (TX) or has been received (RX)
transceiveDirectionQuery.name: transceiveDirection

wfMessage.title: Whiteflag Message
wfMessage.description: Whiteflag message with MetaHeader as used by the API

responseBodyMetaObject.title: API response metadata
responseBodyMetaObject.description: Meta data about the processing of the request

operationId.description: Unique string defined by the OpenAPI defintion used to identify the operation

request.description: Details of the request on the endpoint

client.description: The ip address of the client that made the request

method.description: The HTTP method used to make the request

endpoint.description: The endpoint on which the request has been made

info.description: Information about how the data was processed

warnings.description: Warnings generated when processing the request

errors.description: Errors generated when processing the request

responseBodyErrorObject.title: API response errors
responseBodyErrorObject.description: Errors describing why the request could not succesfully be fulfilled

wfMessage.description: Whiteflag message to be send, encoded/ecrypted, or validated

wfSignaturePayload.description: Payload for a Whiteflag Authentication Signature

blockchain.description: The name of the blockchain used by the originator

address.description: The address of the originator blockchain account with which the token is used

authToken.description: A pre-shared secret authentication token in raw hexadecimal format

transferValue.description: Data required to transfer value to another blockchain account

fromAddress.description: The address of the blockchain account to transfer value from

toAddress.description: The address of the blockchain account to transfer value to

value.description: Value to be transferred in the main currency of the blockchain

privateKey.description: Optional private key in raw hexadecimal format to create account with

originatorData.description: Originator data as stored in Whiteflag protocol state; all properties are optional and only provided properties will be updated

preSharedKey.description: A pre-shared secret encryption key in raw hexadecimal format

blockchain.description: The name of the blockchain used by the originator

address.description: The blockchain address of the originator, if already known

authToken.description: A pre-shared secret authentication token in raw hexadecimal format

error400.description: Invalid request, typically because of a malformed syntax or protocol error

error401.description: Authentication is required and was either not provided or has failed

error403.description: Request is not allowed, typically because the operation is disabled in the configuration

error404.description: Requested resource not found or no data available

error409.description: The request conflicts with an already existing resource

error500.description: Internal error preventing the running API instance to process the request

error501.description: Function not implemented, such as a missing protocol feature or not implemented blockchain

error503.description: Function currently not available, such as unavailable blockchain connection

wfMessage.description: Succesfully processed the Whiteflag message and returning the message with updated MetaHeader

wfMessages.description: Successfully processed Whiteflag message query and returning an array of messages

data.description: Array with resulting messages from a database query

wfSignature.description: Succesfully processed the Whiteflag authentication signature and returning the result

wfSignatureDecoded.description: Succesfully processed the Whiteflag authentication signature and returning the result

wfAuthToken.description: Succesfully created the Whiteflag authentication token verification data and returning the result

VerificationData.description: The authentication token of an originator used as Verification Data in a Whiteflag `A2` authentication message

blockchainsState.description: Successfully retrieved and returning all blockchain configurations and states

blockchainState.description: Successfully retrieved and returning the blockchain configuration and status

blockchainAccounts.description: Successfully retrieved and returning all blockchain accounts

blockchainAccountCreated.description: Successfully created the blockchain account, and returning account data

blockchainAccount.description: Successfully retrieved, updated or deleted the blockchain account, and returning account data

transferValue.description: Successfully transferred value to another blockchain account and returning the transaction hash

transactionHash.description: The transaction hash of the value transfer

originatorsState.description: Successfully retrieved and returning known Whiteflag originators

originatorState.description: Successfully retrieved and returning known Whiteflag originator

originatorAccepted.description: Successfully retrieved and returning known Whiteflag originators

pskAvailable.description: A pre-shared encryption key for the Whiteflag originator is available

pskAccepted.description: Successfully accepted new or updated pre-shared encryption key for the Whiteflag originator

pskDeleted.description: Successfully accepted the delete request for the pre-shared encryption key for the Whiteflag originators

authTokenAvailable.description: An authentication token for the Whiteflag originator is available

authTokenAccepted.description: Successfully accepted the new authentication token for the Whiteflag originator

authTokenDeleted.description: Successfully accepted the delete request for the authentication token of the Whiteflag originator

queueState.description: Successfully retrieved and returning the queue of the running API instance
